item.title: Linux 'io_uring' security blindspot allows stealthy rootkit attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A significant security gap in Linux runtime security caused by the 'io_uring' interface allows rootkits to operate undetected on systems while bypassing advanced Enterprise security software. [...]

item.title: Russian army targeted by new Android malware hidden in mapping app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware has been discovered hidden inside trojanized versions of the Alpine Quest mapping app, which is reportedly used by Russian soldiers as part of war zone operational planning. [...]

item.title: WhatsApp's new Advanced Chat Privacy protects sensitive messages
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: WhatsApp has introduced a new Advanced Chat Privacy feature to protect sensitive information exchanged in private chats and group conversations. [...]

item.title: Blue Shield of California leaked health data of 4.7 million members to Google
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Blue Shield of California disclosed it suffered a data breach after exposing protected health information of 4.7 million members to Google's analytics and advertisement platforms. [...]

item.title: FBI: US lost record $16.6 billion to cybercrime in 2024
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The FBI says cybercriminals have stolen a record $16,6 billion in 2024, marking an increase in losses of over 33% compared to the previous year. [...]

item.title: ASUS releases fix for AMI bug that lets hackers brick servers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ASUS has released security updates to address CVE-2024-54085, a maximum severity flaw that could allow attackers to hijack and potentially brick servers. [...]

item.title: Phishing detection is broken: Why most attacks feel like a zero day
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Push Security
item.description: Phishing attacks now evade email filters, proxies, and MFA — making every attack feel like a zero-day. This article from Push Security breaks down why detection is failing and how real-time, in-browser analysis can help turn the tide. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Remote Desktop freezes caused by Windows updates
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has resolved a known issue causing Remote Desktop sessions to freeze on Windows Server 2025 and Windows 11 24H2 devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Windows Server 2025 blue screen, install issues
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed several known issues that caused Blue Screen of Death (BSOD) and installation issues on Windows Server 2025 systems with a high core count. [...]

item.title: Marks & Spencer confirms a cyberattack as customers face delayed orders
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Marks & Spencer (M&S) has disclosed that it is responding to a cyberattack over the past few days that has impacted operations, including its Click and Collect service. [...]

item.title: Active! Mail RCE flaw exploited in attacks on Japanese orgs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An Active! Mail zero-day remote code execution vulnerability is actively exploited in attacks on large organizations in Japan. [...]

item.title: Hackers abuse Zoom remote control feature for crypto-theft attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A hacking group dubbed 'Elusive Comet' targets cryptocurrency users in social engineering attacks that exploit Zoom's remote control feature to trick users into granting them access to their machines. [...]
